sentence.text: Klara is a plump , good- natured woman who shares the duties of travelling with the girls and enjoying their endless tourist trips , although friends doubt if she has yet learned the moves in chess .
Meese was in his fifties , solid , plump and pink-faced ; a California prosecutor who seemed shocked by nothing , a ` taciturney general " , as one lawyer described him .
Mother was a small , plump lady , more Russian-looking than Jewish .
Perhaps she was never glamorous , nor did she care for make-up , but she was deliciously plump and comely .
There was a plump baby with Herman Katz 's shining eyes , trussed up in a blue nightie , perched unsteadily on the lap of a haggard young woman .
She was small and plump and her hair was tied in bunches like spaniel 's ears .
Standing in their midst , beaming out at the camera , her arms linked with two guests , was the plump figure of Madame Melasse , the former proprietress .
No-one did any over-eating in her family , she was naturally plump .
Miss Withington was a small , plump young woman between Agnes and Prudence in age .
She was plump and fair , with a pleasant face .
The woman was plump , with mousy hair going grey .
He had dark hair and his plump body was covered in filth .

Her dress , cunningly draped around her plump figure , made her look almost voluptuous ; and over her shoulders was carelessly thrown her Persian lamb coat , which made Mrs Frizzell 's eyes glisten with envy .
Her wedding photograph showed her with a prettily plump figure .
A plump , pretty girl , with a sensible scarf , two badges on the lapel of her corduroy overcoat , her face and stance vibrant , unflinching , exalted …
The plump girl , who had been so full of life , was killed in the same way as the earlier victims .
While they were in their last port of call , the Volunteer , Tommy even disappeared out of the pub followed by the barmaid , a pert , slightly plump girl called Rose .
A plump man in a three-piece suit shook Susan 's hand .
A plump old man sitting in a wooden scaffold on a marine building site sawed the top off an immense teak column to make it flush with the decking .
The plump man who , unfortunately , did n't have an up-to-date snapshot to send her , may just turn out to be that elusive Mr Right .
A plump man , piscine , his tail end fading to little leather pumps , came out of the shop gesticulating , clutching his sweating ginger head .
Plump women are never featured either .
One was occupied by a plump woman in her forties , who was briskly sorting through a pile of letters .
A plump middle-aged woman wearing a white coat greeted them when the doors opened again .
` At least , " Ruth sobbed , held against Mrs Taylor 's plump form , ` at least he never knew the worst about me ! "
A plump monk named Bertie showed Melinda and me round the monastery while the pilgrims ate noisily in a fly-ridden refectory .
Stocky , well-fed merchants walked arm-in-arm with their plump wives , clad in garments of silk and satin , decorated with miniature pearls of exquisite delicacy .
Agnes watched the young , plump , matronly lady look at the young man , whom she imagined to be the same age as his wife .
You 're too short and too plump -- though your skin 's not that bad .
The doctor , short , plump with thinning white hair , raised his eyebrows .
His body had become plump and loose .
